text: [Music]
as a channel partner you can create
private offers for your customers from
the resale authorization that an AWS
marketplace seller has shared with you
In this video you will learn how to
create a private offer for your customer
from your Salesforce CRM using the AWS
partner CRM connector The partner CRM
connector integrates AWS Marketplace and
APN directly into your Salesforce
environment This integration empowers
your sales team to efficiently co-ell
and sell with
AWS For channel partners it
significantly streamlines the management
of a shared resale authorization and
facilitates the creation and management
of private offers enhancing your ability
to customize solutions for your
customers Before you can create a
private offer from a resale
authorization shared with you your
Salesforce account must be configured
with the AWS Marketplace module of the
partner CRM connector
You can find resources to configure that
connector at the end of this
video Once you've configured the partner
CRM connector to browse resell
authorizations available from the seller
in your Salesforce CRM you can open the
shared resell authorization
section Here is a resale authorization
from a seller for a SAS product This
authorization is valid until October
31st 2025 and it allows the channel
partner to generate multiple customized
offers for various clients during this
period Here is the pricing that the
seller has associated with the product
The seller has also associated a
reseller contract which the channel
partner must accept and an enduser
license agreement that the buyer must
accept Here's a quick sneak peek of the
reseller
contract And here is the contract that
the customer would need to agree to Now
I will show you the private offer
creation
workflow First you need to provide the
customer's AWS account number The
customer will accept the private offer
using the AWS account number you provide
To be able to create a private offer you
must accept the reseller agreement that
the seller associated with the resell
authorization Next you can specify an
offer name for the offer you're about to
create Then you can specify whether the
entitlement to the product will start
immediately after the buyer accepts the
offer For this demo I will leave the
service length as
default As a channel partner you provide
value to your customers and want to be
paid for the same Under the price
adjustment section you can specify your
markup
percentage Note how the connector
calculates the final price which
customers will see on their private
offer page This final price was
calculated based on the markup
percentage you specified and the
wholesale price specified by the seller
Here is the enduser license agreement
specified by the seller that the
customer would agree
to In addition to the agreement attached
by the seller optionally you can attach
your own custom terms and conditions
that the customer must agree
to Finally you can specify an offer
expiration
date and then go ahead and create the
offer Once the offer is ready its status
changes to
succeeded You can review the details of
the offer and then preview the private
offer you just extended to your
customer Here's the customer's view of
your private
offer Note how the pricing you specified
was associated with your private offer
Congratulations you just learned how to
create an AWS Marketplace private offer
from a shared resale authorization using
the AWS partner CRM connector Check out
these resources to learn how to
configure and use the partner CRM
connector And thanks for watching
